headline: Maple Bacon Monkey Bread
description: This maple monkey bread recipe has a special addition — bacon! It's a wonderful mix of sweet and salty and will make everyone happy at brunch.

video.description: The ultimate sweet and salty brunch treat to please every bacon lover.
video.name: Maple Bacon Monkey Bread

name: Maple Bacon Monkey Bread
recipeIngredient: 2 (16.3 ounce) packages refrigerated biscuit dough, separated and cut into quarters

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat the inside of a 9-inch fluted tube pan (such as Bundt) with cooking spray.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Crumble when cool enough to handle; discard any pieces that are all fat.
Melt margarine in a small saucepan over medium heat; stir in brown sugar and maple syrup and bring to a boil. Cook and stir until mixture begins to foam, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat.
Mix white sugar and cinnamon in a resealable plastic bag. Add 6 to 8 biscuit pieces at a time to the bag; shake until well coated. Place sugared biscuits onto a plate and repeat to coat the rest.
Empty any sugar mixture from the resealable bag into maple syrup mixture; place the saucepan over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves, 2 to 3 minutes.
Make four layers of ingredients in the prepared pan as follows: bacon, maple syrup mixture, biscuits. Finish with the last drizzle of maple syrup mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until biscuits are cooked through, about 35 minutes. Allow to cool in the pan for 10 to 20 minutes, then invert onto a serving plate.

review.reviewBody: I have made this recipe a couple of times. Sooooo delicious and everyone loves it.
Only change used real bread dough and added some cream to my caramel sauce. Its really good, i was a bit sceptical cause i always thought candied bacon sounded gross but caramel bacon is pretty good.

I made this twice the first time the biscuit was undercooked and I had to double the bacon and the brown sugar syrup and both times the prep time took 1 1/2 hours-2 1/2 hours not 30 minutes. I also had to cook the monkey bread for at least 45 minutes so I don’t recommend this recipe
Used real butter, light brown sugar, and added chopped pecans. Was pretty fast and easy to make; yummy, gooey goodness!!!
This was a big hit. Easy to make.
My son loved this!
This is one of my hubby's favorite desserts. It's so easy and delicious!! Also I added 1/4 cup of honey or agave and some crushed pecans to the recipe.
This was a hit! My son said it was the best thing he had ever put in his mouth!
Yummy, I added small pieces of craft Carmel also. And, used butter not margarine. Could have left it out the Carmel, because the sauce sets up nicely.
Make it just as the recipe is written. My husband and kids love it and so do my husband's coworkers who ask for it quite frequently.
I made this for a gathering and it was a knockout! My hubby loved it so much he asked me to make it again the next day.
Delicious!
quick easy perfect brunch dessert for the beach!
I don’t have a Bundt pan so I halved the recipe and cooked it in a 9 x 9 baking dish. I added some toasted pecans and it was fantastic!
You could probably use 3 tubes of biscuits

Made with basic yeast bread dough from my bread maker - turned out great! but was a bit more work - will try again with refrigerated biscuit dough. Used a pizza cutter to cut the dough as other reviewers have mentioned, which made it very quick and easy. I put it all together in the bundt pan the night before, covered and refrigerated overnight, in the morning I warmed the sauce and spooned it over while the oven preheated, then baked as directed so the bread was warm for Easter morning. Making another pan for dessert!

Followed others’ advice to candy the bacon, added chopped toasted pecans to the bacon crumble, halved the recipe and baked in a muffin tin for mini single servings. Otherwise followed the recipe exactly. It was EXCELLENT.
Made it! It was awesome!

oh ya oh ya
oh YA YA YAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
Yum the way it is
As I do with all first time recipes, I made it as directed. Wonder ful!!
The recipe didn’t mention what kind of biscuits so I used the flakey and it was a big hit, disappeared fast! I would definitely make it again!
I have made this recipe twice, following the instructions to the letter. I wouldn't change a thing, it's a delicious and fun dish.
Great recipe . The only thing I did different was I had maple sugar and used that with cinnamon to coat biscuits. Yummy!!
I made this yesterday exactly as written, and it was wonderful! My husband couldn't stop eating it.
I made the recipe exactly as written and it was fantastic! This will definitely be my go to for monkey bread from now on.
Made a holiday version with molasses, cloves, and ginger. Very tasty.
I used frozen biscuit dough as directed and it was greasy. I used frozen bread dough and it was much better. Just follow directions for thawing if it is frozen.
Everyone loved it and yes I’d make it again in a heart beat

What drew me in was the maple. I'm not a big fan of bacon, so I left it out and used pecans. I hate being that person who changes recipes then reviews, but the maple flavor in the caramel was so yummy.
Used a little less butter instead of margarine and made up the difference with bacon fat. Also added a little ginger and cloves.
Made it an was so good. But I didn't put bacon in it.
Great
Wow this was fantastic. It is a lot so share with others. I have kept the leftovers so will let you know if it warms back up well.

I love this recipe because I am not a baker, so it helped me feel accomplished in an area which I am not proficient . I made it as suggested, except I added chopped pecans to the top. In the future I will use maple flavoring and real butter, and flaky biscuits, instead of buttermilk (that's what I had in the fridge). This recipe is fantastic- great for brunch, breakfast or dessert.

Incredible ! Taste testers approved. I’m always taking new baking recipes to my puppies vet. The girls are awesome. It was like singing chorus of omg omg omg. This monkey bread STAYED gooey pull apart. Not stuck and hard like regular ones. The maple syrup and DARK brown sugar are the key. Bacon. I do it in microwave in between paper towels. No grease no cleanup crispy bacon. 

About the pan, yes a bundt ‘style ‘pan is needed. I don’t have. I improvised. Used heavy duty Reynolds aluminum foil. Lined my 2 piece angle food pan, massive lining. Again no clean up, no leaks. Did not stock to cake. I wanted a one person size serving. For me. I took a high sided sauce pan. Again. Massively lined with foil. I made a cone for middle. Firm like you would a foil ball, but mine was cone shaped. It looked hilarious. It worked incredibly good. So, no bundt pan. Get creative and use foil ! No need to spray and comes off if you let cool about 5 minute then flip and remove foil. Have fun making and eating. It’s essy and incredible !

My husband said " DO NOT lose that recipe". We loved it!!. Next time, I will probably add a little more bacon and a little less syrup. Make sure you "dump" it into a large pie plate type dish, the syrup will run.
So yummy. It's like a cinnamon bun on crack.
Very salty. Next time I'll try using low sodium bacon and biscuits.

I made this for my other half a couple days late for his birthday. We were on a birthday trip that didn't include cake :( It was a great recipe. I made the dough using my kitchen aid mixer and followed the manufacturer's directions using these ingredients. I did let it rise after assembling for about 30 minutes.
Made it exactly and it was so freaking good!
VERY GOOD. NEXT TIME I WONT ADD THE CINNAMON SUGAR MIX.
My family like it. We are going to try it with butter instead of margarine next time.
It was fabulous
Everyone loved it!
Was a big hit @ club get together. Will make again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've made this twice and it's to die for! I used thick bacon this time and liked biting into more substantial pieces of salty flavor. This bread makes for a nice presentation on the table and slices well. I will only make when I have company as it is too hard to resist for my husband and me. So good!!
I followed the recipe turned out great family loved it
Wow! Made this for my husband and he LOVES IT!!! It is ooey-gooey and tastes amazing!

A new favorite in our house! I made the recipe as written 
 At first I thought that it would tricky and take a long time to make the sugar syrup. I was wrong! It couldn't be easier! It only takes a minute or two to make it. The whole recipe is quick, easy, and delicious!
OMG, it came out fantastic.
Yes I would make it again I used maple bacon instead
OMG, it is fantastic!!!!! This is LOVELY!!! It’s perfect!!!!!

Absolutely perfect! My husband loved it. Perfect amount of sweet & salty flavors. I used a one-gallon storage bag for the biscuit/sugar/cinnamon mixture and it coated them perfectly with no sugar mix leftover. The top does get a little crusty while baking, but softens up with the glaze when you dump it on a plate. This will be my new go-to holiday breakfast treat. Should be easy to prep most ingredients the night before and bake up quickly the next day. Deliciousness!
Way too sweet! Will try again using less sugar and like the idea of peppering the bacon. Monkey bread is fun so worth experimenting.
Not only did I make this but I made it in a Crock Pot, and it was wonderful. My brother asks it there was any of the sauce left over. I too the recipe for Crock Pot Monkey Bread and applied this on.
Simply FANTASTIC! Made it several
Prepared this as shown in recipe and it was so yummy.

Wow Amazing! Used 3 tubes of biscuit dough, next time I'll cook all 4 tubes of dough as there was plenty of sweet syrup sauce. Maybe bake lil longer so all the dough in the middle gets cooked and rises more. Made in DeMarle Bundt flexipan turned out onto serving plate perfect.
I love this recipe, although I did not add the bacon as I had a few people who were eating that probably wouldn't like it. I'd love to give it a go again with the bacon.

Made this for Xmas breakfast and it was the most popular thing on the table. Even my super picky nephew loved it. The only change I made was to bake my bacon in the oven (425 deg F for 20 mins) so that it was all done at once. Came together faster because while the bacon was doing its thing, I could cut and coat the biscuits and make the caramel and then when the bacon was done, it was all ready to assemble. This is going to be a staple for Xmas breakfast in my house from now on!
I'm not a sweets person, but everyone loved the monkey bread. I used real butter instead of margarine, added a extra 1/4 cup of maple syrup. Winner!

Monkey Bread is my daughter's absolute favorite. Her eyes lit up when she saw her birthday surprise this past weekend. I did not add the excess cinnamon/sugar. Other than that, I followed the directions to a T. It was a big hit! It was just as good cool as it was warm. I'll be making this frequently!
Loved this
My family loved it!
Very good.
Very good.
Added 1 tsp vanilla extract + 1/8 tsp maple flavoring to butter/brown sugar/maple syrup pot after removing from heat. Added chopped walnuts with bacon layers
simple and delicious Made it for Fathers Day brunch everyone loved it.

I made this exactly as written and will definitely make it again. I am pretty much a scratch baker so not a fan of convenience products and shied away because of the canned biscuits. I made this for Father's Day 2017, and we loved it, a big hit for all. Give it a try!
I made just a little more topping to pour over the bread. It was wonderful as is or with the extra umph. Fast, easy, inexpensive, delicious. What more could you want?
Great , I loved this dish
It is pretty sweet especially when you get a piece of the sugar and maple syrup. Wow. Baking for 35 min. in my oven was not quite long enough. I had to do about 40 min.
It was a big hit at work, and not hard to make.
I made 3 Monkey Breads and took them to a meeting. The members loved them there was any left over.

I made this ,this morning. I substituted frozen bread dough,thawed, as I had it on hand. I also substituted light brown sugar for the dark, for the same reason. This was absolutely my favorite recipe from All Recipes. Sticky hands Down!
Everyone who tried it loved it! Very easy to make.
I made this recipe this morning and it was a real winner. In the future I will use about twice as much beacon and/or add crushed pecans to the recipe. The bottom line is this one is a keeper.
Take some extra time and make your own brioche dough, and omit the refrigerator biscuits, then follow recipe. Very tasty.

this is great! Monkey bread is a big deal in my house, and every new and interesting combination is a hit (you should try our Savory and not sweet - Jalepeno Popper monkey bread! :)) Anyhow, couple of things that work for me and my family that I do differently ... I'd use butter versus margarine. and in place of maple.. honey :) I also recommend thinking about how your family likes their bacon... really crisp, or a bit softer? If softer, I use frozen bacon and chop into smallish pieces before frying no need to crumble if they're small enough and not so crunchy, all about what the family likes right?
:)
I didn't have a big pan so I modified it to a small plate and it worked.
It was good but the bacon adds an unusual taste to it. NOT bad, but is better without bacon in my opinion
My family love's this! I make it with splenda, splenda brown sugar & sugar free maple syrup. No one knows i took most of the sugar out.

My dad always made something very similar to this every Christmas, but honestly, I like this recipe better! It is gooey and sweet, with a nice salty contrast from the bacon. I didn’t make any changes to the recipe (I think it's perfect as is), but to ensure that the top didn't get dry and hard like my dad's always did, I put a piece of foil on top in the last 10 minutes of baking. Perfect! I'm sure I'll be making it again!

I made a half-batch in a loaf pan (fit perfectly), and followed the recipe very closely. Made one substitution of brown sugar to white sugar with 1 T molasses (2 T for full recipe). Took to a work breakfast potluck and it was a HIT! Once flipped, the top was very gooey/saucy, and the bottom was dry-er; it fit everyone's taste preferences! There was NONE leftover and many colleagues requested the recipe.
This was awesome. Followed recipe.
Will definitely make again. Made for Christmas morning and will probably be a new tradition.

I made it for a few family members (minus the bacon) for a holiday dessert. The pieces with more of the mixture on them were entirely too sweet!! I also baked for 35 minutes as instructed and most of the bread was extremely hard. I will give this another try soon adding pecans and reducing the syrup and baking time to see if it comes out better.
This is a sure party pleaser and my favorite monkey bread recipe
I didn't have dark brown sugar so I used light, I also added some peacons. Worked very well my family loved this bread. Arline
Fantastic. My family and neighbors loved it. As we say in my house this is a do over

This came out very good, and no dry top at all. I didn't increase the maple syrup, and all of the caramel topping came out with the monkey bread. I did remove it from a nonstick bundt pan at 20 minutes, it was too hot to work with any earlier. I needed to bake it another 8 minutes to bake all the bread through. 
I used butter since I don't use margarine at all, added a teaspoon of madagascar bourbon vanilla & chopped pecans along with the bacon crumbles. It took me longer than expected to prep. Next time I may forego adding the left over cinnamon sugar to the maple sauce, since it came out very sweet and already has an incredible amount of sugar in it.
This was absolutely delicious and simple to make! A new family favorite!

YUMMO! I made this yesterday! Thoroughly enjoyed the one taste I got! The kids and hubby gobbled it up. Thank you for sharing the recipe. NOTE: I had no problem with the carmel staying on top and oozing down sides making it absolutely a delish and decadent treat.

I followed this recipe closely, with the exception of two changes. The first was that I added an extra 1/4 cup of maple syrup to the brown sugar/margarine mixture to ensure there was enough to coat the top after it was assembled (didn't want "dry tops" like the first reviewer). 

The other change is that I used thick cut bacon (8 slices) and "candied" it first by pressing dark brown sugar liberally onto both sides and sprinkling it with cayenne pepper (this is also referred to as Billionaire's Bacon). Lay it on a cookie sheet lined with foil and bake it in the over at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes. Allow it to cool on parchment and then chop it up into pieces. Overall, it was the perfect combination of smoky, salty and sweet (with just a TOUCH of heat). While all of it was good, the inside pieces were gooey and delicious. We will definitely make this again!
Good flavor but I wasn't a fan of the dry tops. To bad there isn't a way to get the caramel to stay on top after you drizzle it on. I loved the bottom pieces!
